flawed_nl_solution:
When the price of the book is decreased by 3/20, the total price decrease is 3/20*$400=${<<3/20*400=60>>}60
The new price of the book becomes $400-$60 = ${<<400-60=430>>}430
The price of the book is then increased by 2/5*430 = ${<<2/5*430=172>>}172
The final price of the book is $430+$172 = ${<<430+172=602>>}602

error_details.explanation: The result of this computation should be 340, not 430. It appears two adjacent digits were swapped.
